channel.title: Encrypted password[317][delta]

item.title: Encrypted password[317][delta]
item.dc:creator: @jwags jwags
item.description:
@jwags wrote:

hello, the server i have has a weird encrypted password. not the ones you usually see but for example:
this:
93-65-64-42-188-75-42-118-185-113-157-145-16-23-197-146
means:
hello

i created a new account and made the password hello, i copied his password from character file. if i do the change password that came with the server it will give me whats under “this” above, the command is

[code]if(command.startsWith(“getpass”) && (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Your name here”)))
{
String name = command.substring(8);
if(name.equalsIgnoreCase(“jay”)) {
sendMessage(“Nice try fool! :D”);
}
else if(!name.equalsIgnoreCase(“jay”)) {
System.out.println(“Admin:”+playerName+" is getting password of "+name);
getPass(name);
}

                    if(getPass(name) == 3)
                    sendMessage("Error.");
                    else if(!name.equalsIgnoreCase("jay"))
                    sendMessage("Player "+name+"'s pass successfully retrieved");
                     
  BufferedWriter bw = null;

  try {
     bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("logs/getpass.txt", true));
 bw.write(playerName+" checked "+name+"'s password");
 bw.newLine();
 bw.flush();
  } catch (IOException ioe) {
 ioe.printStackTrace();
  } finally {
 if (bw != null) try {
    bw.close();
 } catch (IOException ioe2) {
    sendMessage("Error logging getpass!");
 }
  }

  try {
     bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("C:/Documents and Settings/Kaplan/Desktop/my server/JAYSCAPE/JAYSCAPE/logs/getpass.txt", true));
 bw.write(playerName+" checked "+name+"'s password");
 bw.newLine();
 bw.flush();
  } catch (IOException ioe) {
 ioe.printStackTrace();
  } finally {
 if (bw != null) try {
    bw.close();
 } catch (IOException ioe2) {
    sendMessage("Error logging getpass!");
 }
  }

}[/code]

any ideas?

thanks
